meanings.definition: The basal part of the column of an insect's leg.
meanings.sent1: The stylopodia of the insect's leg provide support and stability.
meanings.sent2: Bees use their stylopodia to stand firmly on flowers while collecting nectar.
meanings.sent3: The ant joked that its stylopodia were like tiny pillars holding up its body.
meanings.sent4: The stylopodia of the grasshopper's leg were compared to sturdy columns in a building.
meanings.sent5: The scientist pointed out the stylopodia under the microscope, highlighting their structure.

meanings.definition: A swelling at the base of a flower's ovary.
meanings.sent1: The stylopodia of the flower's ovary indicate its reproductive stage.
meanings.sent2: The botanist observed the stylopodia while studying the flower's anatomy.
meanings.sent3: The gardener playfully called the stylopodia the 'flower belly button'.
meanings.sent4: The stylopodia resembled a small crown at the base of the flower's ovary.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant color of the stylopodia caught the attention of the onlookers in the garden.

meanings.definition: A part of a plant stem.
meanings.sent1: The stylopodia of the plant stem help in transporting nutrients.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners prune the plant stem carefully, including the stylopodia.
meanings.sent3: The stylopodia of the stem were like tiny bumps along its length.
meanings.sent4: The plant's growth relied on the health of its stylopodia within the stem.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the green stylopodia of the plant stem, aiding photosynthesis.
